titleStmt.title: A sermon preached before the Honourable House of Commons at Saint Margarets in Westminster, on Thursday the 10. of May, being a day of solemn thanksgiving appointed by the Parliament, for the mercies God had bestowed on the nation through the successfull conduct of the Lord Generall Monck. By John Price M.A. Fellow of Kings Colledge in Cambridge, and chaplain to his Excellency.
titleStmt.author: Price, John, 1625?-1691.

titleStmt.title: A sermon preached before the Honourable House of Commons at Saint Margarets in Westminster, on Thursday the 10. of May, being a day of solemn thanksgiving appointed by the Parliament, for the mercies God had bestowed on the nation through the successfull conduct of the Lord Generall Monck. By John Price M.A. Fellow of Kings Colledge in Cambridge, and chaplain to his Excellency.
titleStmt.author: Price, John, 1625?-1691.
England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by J.G. for Richard Royston, at the Angel in Ivie-lane,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A sermon preached before the House of Commons.
With an order to print on the verso of the title page signed: W. Jessop, clerk of the Commons House of Parliam.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
